column4: anybody know the name of the source package for ipw2200 drivers?
I do not see anything in there that saws ipw2200
I think I downloaded the module from the Debian website. I think it is in unstable there, but you can search that site. And it works!
maybe I am mistaking!!!! it is linux-wlan-ng (different lines) :)
what is not in where? I did not add any reposities, but it is in my synaptic

where did I mention it should. I am on this moment using that driver on my laptop (I am on wireless) and I installed it via linux-wlan-ng. And that command you gave me does not return anything in my bash...
my ubuntu kernel contains a ipw2200 module
go to the website and download it. What is difficult about htat
it is harder than typing apt-get ;)
I should not do this because it is easy to find but here you have it: http://packages.debian.org/unstable/source/linux-wlan-ng
